questions.text: Match the Necrosis with Characteristic Histology
Which enzyme is responsible for the production of hypochlorous acid (HOCl) in neutrophils during oxidative burst?

A 17-year-old girl from Punjab is referred for anemia evaluation. She has had progressively worsening fatigue over the months. There is no history of bleeding. She has mild pallor but no jaundice or organomegaly. Her CBC reveals Hb 9.2 g/dL, MCV 68 fL, RBC count ↑ and normal RDW. Her hemoglobin electrophoresis shows HbA2 5.2% and HbF 2.5%. What is the most appropriate interpretation?
Which of the following is not a contributor to the formation of the apoptosome?
Which of the following correctly pairs a chemokine with its primary leukocyte attractant function in acute inflammation?
A mutation in FasL results in failure of lymphocyte apoptosis. Which disorder is most likely?
Match mediator with inflammatory effect
A vegan develops a macrocytic anemia with elevated homocysteine, normal MMA, and no neurological symptoms. What is the most likely deficiency?
Match Apoptosis Regulator with Function
Which of the following laboratory values would most reliably distinguish PNH from autoimmune hemolytic anemia?
Match the WBC Disorder with its Molecular Pathogenesis

A 19-year-old male from Odisha presents with sudden onset fatigue, mild jaundice, and dark urine. He has no history of recent travel, transfusion, or fever. He mentions eating fava beans two days ago. On examination: he has pallor and mild scleral icterus and there is no splenomegaly. Laboratory investigations reveal Hb 7.8 g/dL, Reticulocyte count ↑, LDH ↑, haptoglobin ↓ and a negative Coombs test. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Acute hemolysis in sickle cell trait

questions.text: A patient presents with mucocutaneous bleeding and prolonged bleeding time. Platelet aggregation studies reveal normal response to ADP, epinephrine, and collagen, but absent response to ristocetin, which does not correct with normal plasma. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old male presents with painless cervical lymphadenopathy, fever, night sweats, and weight loss. A lymph node biopsy reveals Reed-Sternberg cells positive for CD15 and CD30, with a background of lymphocytes, eosinophils, and plasma cells. Which of the following is the most likely subtype of Hodgkin lymphoma in this patient?

A 35-year-old male with a history of mild hemophilia A presents with spontaneous hemarthrosis and prolonged bleeding after a minor dental procedure. He was previously well-controlled on factor VIII infusions, but his recent activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) remains prolonged despite factor VIII replacement. Mixing studies are performed, and the aPTT remains prolonged after mixing with normal plasma. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for these findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Factor VIII deficiency due to an acquired somatic mutation

options.label: B
options.text: Development of an autoantibody against factor VIII

options.label: C
options.text: Vitamin K deficiency impairing factor carboxylation

options.label: D
options.text: Disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) causing factor consumption

questions.correct_answer: B. Development of an autoantibody against factor VIII
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Development of an autoantibody against factor VIII

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman presents with an enlarged cervical lymph node. Biopsy shows LP ("popcorn") cells with a CD20+ CD30− CD15− BCL6+ phenotype in a nodular background of small lymphocytes. Which of the following best describes the pattern of lymph node involvement in this disease?

options.label: B
options.text: Extranodal involvement with early dissemination to the spleen

options.label: C
options.text: Frequent involvement of mesenteric and Waldeyer's ring lymph nodes

options.label: D
options.text: Localized nodal disease, often without mediastinal involvement

questions.correct_answer: D. Localized nodal disease, often without mediastinal involvement
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Localized nodal disease, often without mediastinal involvement

questions.text: A 52-year-old male with chronic kidney disease has normocytic anemia. Labs: ↑ ferritin, ↓ TIBC, ↓ serum iron. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following tests is most specific for diagnosing Paroxysmal Nocturnal Hemoglobinuria?

A 75-year-old man with no history of hemochromatosis undergoes an autopsy after dying of natural causes. His liver and heart exhibit golden-brown perinuclear granules that do not stain with Prussian blue. Which of the following best describes the composition of these granules?

options.label: A
options.text: Hemosiderin derived from iron overload in macrophages

options.label: B
options.text: Oxidized phospholipids and cross-linked proteins from lipid peroxidation

options.label: C
options.text: Retained metabolic intermediates due to lysosomal enzyme deficiency

options.label: D
options.text: Calcium phosphate deposits secondary to dystrophic calcification

questions.correct_answer: B. Oxidized phospholipids and cross-linked proteins from lipid peroxidation
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Oxidized phospholipids and cross-linked proteins from lipid peroxidation

questions.text: Which of the following features distinguishes intravascular from extravascular hemolysis?
Which of the following best describes platelet findings in Glanzmann thrombasthenia?

options.label: A
options.text: Normal platelet count, defective aggregation with all agonists except ristocetin

options.label: B
options.text: Low platelet count, large platelets, defective ADP response

options.label: C
options.text: Normal platelet count, hyperaggregation with collagen

questions.correct_answer: A. Normal platelet count, defective aggregation with all agonists except ristocetin

questions.text: A patient with MAHA, thrombocytopenia, and renal failure is suspected to have DIC. Which test helps distinguish DIC from TTP/HUS?
Which of the following does not show target cells?
Match the following transfusion reactions with their pathophysiology
Match the following cell death pathways with their key triggering event

A 50-year-old man with a history of dyslipidemia presents for routine follow-up. Blood samples are collected into several vacutainers, including a red top tube for serum analysis. After centrifugation, the serum is clear, but the patient’s laboratory results show falsely elevated potassium levels. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this finding?

options.label: D
options.text: Use of a red top tube instead of a green top tube

questions.text: Match the following cytoplasmic inclusions with their associated diseases

A middle aged woman is admitted for severe postpartum hemorrhage and requires an emergency blood transfusion. Crossmatching shows incompatibility with all O-negative donor units. Which of the following is the most appropriate blood product to transfuse in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Only blood from another Bombay phenotype donor

questions.correct_answer: D. Only blood from another Bombay phenotype donor
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Only blood from another Bombay phenotype donor

questions.text: An elderly male with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) presents with fatigue and jaundice. Labs show Hb: 8.2 g/dL, Reticulocyte count: Elevated, Bilirubin: Indirect hyperbilirubinemia, LDH: Elevated and positive Direct Coombs test. Which of the following is the most likely pathophysiologic mechanism?

options.label: A
options.text: Cold agglutinin disease with IgM-mediated complement fixation

options.label: B
options.text: IgG-mediated opsonization of RBCs in the spleen

questions.correct_answer: B. IgG-mediated opsonization of RBCs in the spleen
questions.explanation: Ans. B) IgG-mediated opsonization of RBCs in the spleen

questions.text: A 67-year-old man presents with fatigue, lymphadenopathy, and splenomegaly. A biopsy reveals monomorphic small lymphocytes surrounding the germinal center in a mantle zone distribution. Immunophenotyping shows CD5+, CD19+, and CD20+ but CD23-. Which of the following is the cell of origin of this condition?
All of the following blood components are incorrectly matched except:

options.label: A
options.text: Fresh Frozen Plasma: 5 days at room temperature

options.label: B
options.text: Packed Red Blood Cells: 42 days at 2-6°C

questions.correct_answer: B. Packed Red Blood Cells: 42 days at 2-6°C
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Packed Red Blood Cells: 42 days at 2-6°C

questions.text: A 72-year-old man presents with back pain, fatigue, and recurrent bacterial infections. Lab findings show hypercalcemia, anemia, and elevated serum creatinine. Serum protein electrophoresis shows an M-spike. What is the most likely cause of renal failure in this patient?
questions.correct_answer: B. Cast nephropathy from light chains
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Cast nephropathy from light chains

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presents with painless axillary lymphadenopathy and fever. Lymph node biopsy shows a diffuse large B-cell population positive for CD20 but negative for CD15 and CD30. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 60-year-old man presents with generalized erythroderma and lymphadenopathy. Peripheral blood smear shows circulating atypical lymphocytes with cerebriform nuclei. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 72-year-old man with a 5-year history of chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) presents with rapidly enlarging lymph nodes, fever, and night sweats. Peripheral smear shows large, atypical lymphoid cells. A lymph node biopsy reveals diffuse sheets of large B cells with high mitotic activity. What is the most likely underlying molecular transformation?

A trauma patient is to receive blood products. He undergoes TEG which shows: R time: Normal, K and Alpha angle: Normal, MA: Initially normal, then rapidly decreases and LY30: Elevated. What is the most appropriate intervention in this patient?

A 7-year-old boy of Mediterranean descent presents with pallor, mild fatigue, and microcytic anemia. Laboratory findings show: Hemoglobin: 10.5 g/dL, MCV: 70 fL, RBC count: 5.1 million/µL. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following are seen in iron deficiency anemia? Reduced serum iron level Increased transferrin saturation Increased total iron binding capacity Reduced ferritin level

Which of the following findings best differentiate iron deficiency anemia from anemia of chronic disease? Serum ferritin is typically low in IDA but normal or elevated in ACD TIBC is increased in IDA but decreased or normal in ACD Transferrin saturation is increased in ACD and decreased in IDA Serum iron is decreased in both conditions

A 68-year-old male with progressive fatigue and recurrent infections is found to have lymphocytosis on CBC. Peripheral smear shows smudge cells. Flow cytometry reveals a clonal B-cell population expressing CD19, CD5, and CD23. Which of the following cytogenetic findings would be associated with the worst prognosis in this condition?

A 60-year-old man with chronic liver disease is admitted for gastrointestinal bleeding. Labs reveal: PT: 28 sec, aPTT: 55 sec, INR: 2.6, platelet count: 160,000, fibrinogen: 120 mg/dL. No history of inherited bleeding disorders. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial transfusion therapy?

Which of the following options regarding granulocyte concentrates is/are correct? They are stored at 4°C and can be used up to 5 days after collection They contain only neutrophils and no red cells, hence no crossmatching is needed They must be stored at room temperature and transfused within 24 hours They are routinely used in febrile neutropenia responsive to antibiotics

Which of the following are incorrect statements about Hodgkin lymphoma? Reed Sternberg cells are of B cell origin Reed Sternberg cells are CD30 + and PAX 5 + Nodular sclerosis HL uncommonly involves the mediastinum Commonest site for HL is the Waldeyer ring

Which of the following infections is most likely to be transmitted through all blood components, including RBCs, plasma, and platelets, and is NOT reliably inactivated by leukoreduction or pathogen inactivation techniques?

options.label: B
options.text: Human T-cell leukemia virus type I (HTLV-I)

questions.text: A 45-year-old trauma patient is in hypovolemic shock and requires immediate plasma transfusion before blood grouping is completed. Which of the following plasma types is safest to transfuse in this emergency setting?

In the context of Massive Transfusion Protocol (MTP), what is the most commonly recommended ratio of packed red blood cells (PRBCs), fresh frozen plasma (FFP), and platelets to approximate whole blood resuscitation?

A 45-year-old male is undergoing massive transfusion after a road traffic accident. After receiving 10 units of packed RBCs and 6 units of FFP, he develops sudden hypotension and prolonged QT on ECG. Which of the following is the most likely cause?
questions.correct_answer: B. Hypocalcemia due to citrate toxicity
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Hypocalcemia due to citrate toxicity

questions.text: Which of the following best explains why sickled red cells contribute to vaso-occlusion in sickle cell disease?

options.label: A
options.text: They exhibit increased deformability and enhanced nitric oxide release

options.label: B
options.text: They retain a discoid shape and pass easily through capillaries

options.label: C
options.text: They have increased surface area leading to enhanced gas exchange

options.label: D
options.text: They become rigid and adhere to endothelium under low oxygen tension

questions.correct_answer: D. They become rigid and adhere to endothelium under low oxygen tension
questions.explanation: Ans. D) They become rigid and adhere to endothelium under low oxygen tension

questions.text: A hematology lab receives four blood samples for osmotic fragility testing. Based on expected membrane stability, which condition would most likely show increased resistance to hypotonic saline?
Which of the following statements is not correct?

options.label: B
options.text: Hairy cell leukemia: pancytopenia with massive splenomegaly

options.label: C
options.text: Aplastic anemia: pancytopenia with moderate splenomegaly

options.label: D
options.text: Myelodysplastic syndrome: pancytopenia with moderate splenomegaly

questions.correct_answer: C. Aplastic anemia: pancytopenia with moderate splenomegaly
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Aplastic anemia: pancytopenia with moderate splenomegaly
